banner.title: Air quality Monitoring solutions
banner.description: A complete solution to air quality monitoring of PM2.5, PM10, dust emissions, and VOCs at construction and demolition sites.

pollutants.title: Major Air
pollutants.description: Air pollution has been a major cause of concern for a long time now and there one major aspect of it that goes unnoticed is the air pollution due to construction. 30% of the air pollution prevalent in Delhi is caused due to construction pollution i.e. particulate matter – pm2.5, pm10 dust particles produced from the construction sites.

pm.title: PM
pm.description: Fine particles suspended in the air, especially at the sites
pm.imgAlt: pm2.5 pm10 pollutants level at construction site

noise.title: Noise
noise.description: Machinery on the sites creates noise that can cause ear injury.

co.title: CO
co.description: It is produced from the combustion of carbon-based fuels.

vocs.title: VOCs
vocs.description: Activities like welding emits organic compounds & cause illness

nox.title: NOx
nox.description: Burning of fuels used in machinery can release NOx into the air.

vocs.title: VOCs
vocs.description: Exposures can cause dizziness, headaches, and other discomforts.

sox.title: SOx
sox.description: Shifting to alternative fuels can decrease SOx emissions.

nox.title: NOx
nox.description: Causes respiratory problems and is a major cause of acid rain.

pm.title: PM
pm.description: It can cause respiratory and cardiovascular problems.
pm.imgAlt: particulate matter pm2.5 and pm10 at construction site

co.title: CO
co.description: It can cause nausea, dizziness, headaches, and even death at very high levels.

risk.title: Who are at
risk.description: The workers working on the C&D site are affected the most by air pollution. Other than them, people living nearby these areas are affected by both indoor and outdoor air pollution caused by C&D emissions near their homes. These include:

workers.title: Construction workers
workers.description: They are most exposed to various pollution sources

inspector.title: Construction Inspector
inspector.description: They can experience short-term health effects.

surveyor.title: Surveyor
surveyor.description: Eye & respiratory tract irritations, & aggravation in asthma.

children.title: Children
children.description: Their airways are narrower, resulting in more obstructions.

pregnantLadies.title: Pregnant ladies
pregnantLadies.description: PM exposure can cause preterm labor, low-weight deliveries, etc.

oldPeople.title: Old people
oldPeople.description: Aggravates COPD, asthma, and other disorders among old age people.

healthIssues.title: People with health issues
healthIssues.description: Their conditions might worsen and harm organs such as the kidneys, lungs, etc.

guidelines.title: Guidelines for C&D sites
guidelines.description: The government of India recognized the problem and has come up with a solution for dust mitigation. The Ministry of Environment, Forest, and Climate Change recently issued a notice regarding the construction pollution at the project sites in Delhi NCR and other regions that come under the Commission for Air Quality and Management (CAQM).

instructions.intro: A bunch of instructions by Govt. of India is given in order to curb the Construction and Demolition activities in Delhi NCR, India which are as follows:-
instructions.item1: The Government announced that an online tool should be introduced to keep track of whether the pollution control rules are being implemented as per said rules.
instructions.item2: All projects of construction and demolition whose area is 500 square meters or more than 500 square meters which come under Delhi NCR have to register at the web portal.
instructions.item3: Video fencing that is also well-found with remote 4G connectivity should be integrated with the web portal for effective observation of the implementation of pollution control measures.
instructions.item4: All the construction and demolition sites need to be equipped with economical and accurate sensors of the particulate matter, PM10, AND PM2.5. The sensors should be linked to where they can be accessed live at all times by the CPCB, government, and other government bodies.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.description: About Air Quality Solution for construction sites
faq.helpText: Have questions? We're here to help.

q1.question: 1. What are some common air pollutants that are present at C&D sites?
q1.answer: – Common air pollutants present at C&D sites are PM2.5, PM10, CO, NOx, VOCs, etc, and noise.

q2.question: 2. What are the health impacts of the pollutants present at a C&D site?
q2.answer: – Workers and people living nearby are affected the most. The harm can be increased by subsequent exposure to PM and dust pollution. Health effects include eye and respiratory tract irritations, lung and kidney damage, and cancer.

q3.question: 3. What are some effective methods for reducing dust at C&D sites?
q3.answer: – The best methods for reducing dust at C&D facilities include routinely wetting down surfaces, employing dust suppression devices, and making sure enclosed spaces have adequate ventilation.

q4.question: 4. Why is it necessary to have air quality monitoring solutions?
q4.answer: – To know the nature of pollutants and how much they are present at the site so that necessary actions can be taken while complying with the standards under the CAQM.

q5.question: 5. What are some of the regulations that C&D sites must follow in order to maintain appropriate air quality?
q5.answer: – C&D sites are required to abide by rules established by the regional air quality management district or a state agency, which may include restrictions on the number of certain pollutants that can be emitted, measures to reduce dust, and reporting requirements.

q6.question: 6. Other than the air pollutants, do your monitors include any other parameters?
q6.answer: – Yes, you can keep an eye on the humidity, noise, and temperature of a place.

q7.question: 7. Are there any further advantages to the solutions?
q7.answer: – Customizable dashboard, 24*7 remote access to the data, health suggestions, real-time and historical data analysis, QR code to scan for real-time AQI in that location, and much more.
